net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.nonsense

Class NonsenseBuilderTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.nonsense.NonsenseBuilderTest

  • public class NonsenseBuilderTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Exercises NonsenseBuilder.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#7)

    • Constructor Detail

      • NonsenseBuilderTest

        public NonsenseBuilderTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()

      • testConstructor

        public void testConstructor()
        Exercises the context-only constructor, verifying that the context supplied in setUp() is the same one reported by the builder. Since this constructor invokes NonsenseBuilder.setContext(android.content.Context), there is no need to separately test that method.

      • testConfiguredConstructor

        public void testConfiguredConstructor()
        Exercises the full constructor, and also the builder-based paradigm for passing in a NonsenseBuilder.Configuration instance. Since the constructor invokes NonsenseBuilder.setConfiguration(net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.nonsense.NonsenseBuilder.Configuration), there is no need to separately test that method.

      • testLockingMethods

        public void testLockingMethods()
        Exercises the locking methods for each of the sentence segments.

      • testRandomOutputs

        public void testRandomOutputs()
        This method makes no assertions, and will trivially pass. It exercises the NonsenseBuilder.getString() method several times, using the default configuration, and dumps the output to the logs. Only by examining the output will you be able to see the strings that are generated, which, in Android Studio, is far more troublesome than you'd think.
